result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy Durr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #15CF412-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Durr to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  23 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 37 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #15CF408 and with Racine County Case #15CF512. 

***********
03/23/17: Court orders each JOC be amended to reflect 36 months Extended Supervision**********

Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #15CF408 and #15CF412 called at 10:17am. 
Defendant Leroy  Durr in court, in custody, with Attorney Bradley J Jansen.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews with Mr. Durr the Criminal Case Settlement form, verifying with Mr. Durr that he understands and joins in the agreement.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " Guilty  " entered on Case #15CF408-Count #1 and on Case #15CF412-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds  Mr. Durr guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CF408-Count #3.

On Case #15CF408-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Durr to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  23 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 37 months.  This sentence is forthwith, concurrent with Case #15CF412 and concurrent with Racine County Case #15CF512.
On Case #15CF412-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Durr to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  23 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 37 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with Case #15CF408 and with Racine County Case #15CF512. 

The Court finds that Mr. Durr is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Durr is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
As to both cases the Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no presence at any Premier Bank location in Jefferson County
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--in Case #15CF412 only: to pay $17,752.56 in restitution to Premier Bank, joint and several with Co-Defendant Nelson R Sanchez Torres
--in Case #15CF412 only: to pay the resitution surcharge
--to submit a DNA sample upon demand
--to pay costs, fees and surcharges including the DNA surcharges


Felony Firearm prohibition/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:50am.

[MK] cases #15CF408 and #15CF412 called at 10:45am.
Defendant Leroy  Durr in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court addresses Mr. Durr's 7/15/16 letter-request for new counsel. 
Attorney De La Rosa makes a statement, expressing his availability to meet with Mr. Durr.  
After Mr. Durr verifies that he continues to desire new counsel, the Court grants the requests and charges Attorney De La Rosa for arranging for successor Public Defender counsel to be appointed for Mr. Durr.  
During scheduling discussions Mr. Durr indicates that he wishes to appear in person, rather than by videoconference, for the next hearing. The Court grants this request.
recess 10:50am

Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #15CF408 & #15CF412 called at 10:14am. 
Defendant Leroy Durr appears via videoconferencing from New Lisbon Correctional Institution.  His counsel, Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa .  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court addresses the recent letter from Mr. Durr, correcting Mr. Durr that Attorney De La Rosa has not waived any right to Preliminary Hearing.   Mr. Durr indicates that he now realized that, and Mr. Durr confirms that he wishes for Attorney De La Rosa to continue to represent him in these cases.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he had a Pretrial Conference earlier this month.  Attorney De La Rosa requests that the Preliminary Hearings in these cases be set within the next twenty days if possible. 

recess 10:19am. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on both cases on 5/6/16 at 8:30am. (State will need to file Writ)

Court's Response - Your lawyer did not waive any hearing on March 4. He only waived time limits so that he and you would have more time to work on the case before a perliminary hearing is conducted. I will conisder your request for a new lawyer at your next hearing which is currently set for April 22 at 10 am
